title: JavaScript: The Definitive Guide
author: David Flanagan
details: Since 1996, JavaScript: The Definitive Guide has been the bible for JavaScript programmers—a programmer's guide and comprehensive reference to the core language and to the client-side JavaScript APIs defined by web browsers.

title: JavaScript: The Good Parts
author: Douglas Crockford
details: Most programming languages contain good and bad parts, but JavaScript has more than its share of the bad, having been developed and released in a hurry before it could be refined

title: The Principles of Object-Oriented JavaScript
author: Zakas
details: If you've used a more traditional object-oriented language, such as C++ or Java, JavaScript probably doesn't seem object-oriented at all.

title: Effective JavaScript
author: David Herman
details: It’s uncommon to have a programming language wonk who can speak in such comfortable and friendly language as David does. His walk through the syntax and semantics of JavaScript is both charming and hugely insightful; reminders of gotchas complement realistic use cases, paced at a comfortable curve.

title: Professional JavaScript
author: Nicholas C. Zakas
details: This book provides a developer-level introduction along with more advanced and useful features of JavaScript.

title: Web Development with Node and Express
author: Ethan Brown
details: Learn how to build dynamic web applications with Express, a key component of the Node/JavaScript development stack. In this hands-on guide, author Ethan Brown teaches you the fundamentals through the development of a fictional application that exposes a public website and a RESTful API.

title: Express in Action
author: Evan Hahn
details: Express in Action is a carefully designed tutorial that teaches you how to build web applications using Node and Express.

title: Node.js the Right Way
author: Wilson
details: Get to the forefront of server-side JavaScript programming by writing compact, robust, fast, networked Node applications that scale.

title: MEAN Web Development
author: Amos Q. Haviv
details: Master real-time web application development using a mean combination of MongoDB, Express, AngularJS, and Node.js

title: Node.js, MongoDB, and AngularJS Web Development
author: Brad Dayley
details: Also known as the MEAN stack, Node.js, MongoDB, and AngularJS are three new web development technologies that together provide an easy to implement, fully integrated web development stack.

title: MongoDB: The Definitive Guide
author: Chodorow
details: Manage the huMONGOus amount of data collected through your web application with MongoDB. This authoritative introduction—written by a core contributor to the project—shows you the many advantages of using document-oriented databases, and demonstrates how this reliable, high-performance system allows for almost infinite horizontal scalability.

title: MongoDB Basics
author: Peter Membrey
details: Need a quick and easy to understand introduction to MongoDB and NoSQL databases? MongoDB Basics, from The Definitive Guide to MongoDB, 2E, shows you how a document-oriented database system differs from a relational database, and how to install and get started using it. You'll also learn MongoDB design basics, including geospatial indexing, how to navigate, view, and query your database, and how to use GridFS with a bit of Python.

title: MongoDB Data Modeling
author: Wilson da Rocha Franca
details: This book is intended for database professionals, software developers, and architects who have some previous experience with MongoDB and now want to shift their focus to the concepts of data modeling. If you wish to develop better schema designs for MongoDB-based applications, this book is ideal for you.

title: MongoDB Applied Design Patterns
author: Copeland
details: Whether you’re building a social media site or an internal-use enterprise application, this hands-on guide shows you the connection between MongoDB and the business problems it’s designed to solve. You’ll learn how to apply MongoDB design patterns to several challenging domains, such as ecommerce, content management, and online gaming. Using Python and JavaScript code examples, you’ll discover how MongoDB lets you scale your data model while simplifying the development process.

title: MongoDB in Action
author: Kyle Banker
details: MongoDB in Action, Second Edition is a completely revised and updated version. It introduces MongoDB 3.0 and the document-oriented database model. This perfectly paced book gives you both the big picture you'll need as a developer and enough low-level detail to satisfy system engineers.

title: Learning Angular 2
author: Pablo Deeleman
details: The first and best overview of Angular 2 on the market—this guide gathers together everything there is to know about Angular 2 and groups it into intuitive sections

title: Pro TypeScript
author: Steve Fenton
details: JavaScript is everywhere, both as a pure language and in popular libraries like Angular, jQuery and Knockout, but users of modern object-oriented languages like Java and C# often find JavaScript frustrating to use and hard to extend to large-scale applications.

title: Switching to Angular 2
author: Minko Gechev
details: AngularJS is a JavaScript framework that makes building web applications easier. It is used today in large-scale, high-traffic websites that struggle with under-performance, portability issues, as well as SEO unfriendliness, and complexity at scale.

title: Angular 2 Development with TypeScript
author: Fain
details: Angular 2 is a JavaScript-based development platform for building dynamic, interactive web applications, SPAs, and mobile apps. Angular applications can be built with JavaScript or TypeScript. TypeScript offers great IDE support and the TypeScript compiler helps coders quickly find and fix errors.

title: Practical Angular 2
author: Daniel Pedrinha Georgii
details: Create web applications with the new Angular 2 framework that was totally remodeled with new concepts and implementations.

title: React: Up & Running
author: Stoyan Stefanov
details: Hit the ground running with React, the open-source technology from Facebook for building rich web applications fast. With this practical guide, Facebook web developer Stoyan Stefanov teaches you how to build components--React's basic building blocks--and organize them into maintainable, large-scale apps. If you're familiar with basic JavaScript syntax, you're ready to get started.

title: Pro React
author: Cassio de Sousa Antonio
details: Pro React teaches you how to successfully structure increasingly complex front-end applications and interfaces. This book explores the React library in depth, as well as detailing additional tools and libraries in the React ecosystem, enabling you to create complete, complex applications.

title: Getting Started with React
author: Doel Sengupta
details: A light but powerful way to build dynamic real-time applications using ReactJS

title: React.js Essentials
author: Artemij Fedosejev
details: A fast-paced guide to designing and building scalable and maintainable web apps with React.js

title: Mastering React
author: Adam Horton
details: Master the art of building modern web applications using React

title: ReactJS by Example
author: Vipul A M
details: ReactJS is an open-source JavaScript library that brings the power of reactive programming to web applications and sites. It aims to address the challenges encountered in developing single-page applications, and is intended to help developers build large, easily scalable and changing web apps.

title: Learning React
author: Porcello
details: nterested in React but find yourself confused about how to use it with the Flux architecture? This is your book. Authors Alex Banks and Eve Porcello show you how to build React applications with the entire React ecosystem—including Flux. You’ll learn about the methodologies behind the creation of the library and its related tools through short interviews with key players in the React community.
